relating to connections that involve sugar molecules (= groups of atoms): This substance is formed before the glycosidic bond is cleaved. The sugars are joined by glycosidic linkages, forming polymers of varying sizes.
More examplesFewer examplesPolysaccharides are made by joining many monosaccharide molecules, with each successive monosaccharide being added by means of a glycosidic bond.Here, the glycosidic bond is formed between carbon atoms 1 and 4 of neighbouring monosaccharides.This enzyme cleaves the bond between the carbon atom and the glycosidic oxygen atom.
